uk.ac.ebi.gxa.index.builder.service
Class IndexBuilderService

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ebi.gxa.index.builder.service.IndexBuilderService
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExperimentAtlasIndexBuilderService, GeneAtlasIndexBuilderService, PropertiesIndexBuilderService
public abstract class IndexBuilderService
extends Object

An abstract IndexBuilderService, that provides convenience methods for getting and setting parameters required across all SOLR index building implementations. This class contains a single method, buildIndex(ProgressUpdater) that clients should use to construct the different types of index in a consistent manner. Implementing classes have access to an org.apache.solr.client.solrj.embedded.EmbeddedSolrServer to update the index, and an AtlasDAO that provides interaction with the Atlas database (following an Atlas 2 schema).

All implementing classes should implement the method createIndexDocs(ProgressUpdater) which contains the logic for constructing the relevant parts of the index for each implementation. Implementations do not need to be concerned with the SOLR index lifecycle, as this is handled by this abstract classes and IndexBuilder implementations.

Author:
Miroslaw Dylag (original version), Tony Burdett (atlas 2 revision)

getLog

buildIndex

public void buildIndex(IndexBuilderService.ProgressUpdater progressUpdater)
                throws IndexBuilderException
Build the index for this particular IndexBuilderService implementation. Once the index has been built, this method will automatically commit any changes and release any resources held by the SOLR server.

Parameters:
progressUpdater - listener for passing progress updates
Throws:
IndexBuilderException - if the is a problem whilst generating the index

createIndexDocs

protected abstract void createIndexDocs(IndexBuilderService.ProgressUpdater progressUpdater)
                                 throws IndexBuilderException
Generate the required documents for the SOLR index, as appropriate to this implementation. This method blocks until all index documents have been created.

Implementations are free to define their own optimization strategy, and it is acceptable to use asynchronous operations.

Throws:
IndexBuilderException - if there is a problem whilst trying to generate the index documents

getName

public abstract String getName()
Returns index name, which this service builds

Returns:
text string
